'''Ahmad Mohammad Nady''' ({{lang-ar|Ø£Ø­ÙØ¯ ÙØ­ÙØ¯ ÙØ§Ø¯Ù}}) is a Egyptian [[political cartoon]]ist, comics artist and an activist. Belonging to a family of artists, Nady began his career early on, steadily rising to become one of the most famous comic artists in Egypt at a young age. He has also worked in political cartoons since an early, and after the [[Egyptian Revolution of 2011]] has became increasingly more active in this area of work, garnering a significant reputation for the boldness of his work.
  +   +
==Biography==
  +
===Background===
  +
Nady was born on December 31, 1981, into an artistic family. His father Mohammad Nady was a cartoonist<ref name="ahram1">{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/News/18633.aspx|title=Ahmad Nady: A budding Egyptian cartoonist - Arts & Culture - Ahram Online |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date= |accessdate=2011-09-21}}</ref> while his mother Iman Ezzat is a sculptor and a writer<ref name="ahram1"/>. In addition to his parents, Nady has cited his childhood and upbringing in the 10th of Ramadan City as an early influence on him towards becoming an artist. He was an avid reader of comic books and magazines as a child, and would occasionally create comic stories with his relatives while he put them to drawing and designed the characters. This turned into a hobby over time and Nady was helped by his father, who acted as his mentor. He would also draw caricatures of his schoolmates and teachers. Among his first comic characters was the "Amazing Mido" ({{lang-ar|ÙÙØ¯Ù Ø§ÙØ¹Ø¬ÙØ¨}} ''Mido al-'Ajeeb''), a young inventor who was subjected to radiation that allowed him to control and change his shape and form very easily.<ref name="mawhopon">[http://www.mawhopon.net/ver_ar/news.php?news_id=4832 Ahmed Nady: One of the most famous comics artists in Egypt]</ref><ref name="youm7">[http://www.youm7.com/News.asp?NewsID=172483 Pharaohs were the first discovered the art of Comics]</ref>
  +   +
According to Nady, his first published cartoon was a political one. The cartoon was made during the [[Gulf War]], while Nady was in elementary school, and it portrayed [[Sindbad]] hitting [[Saddam Hussein]] on the head, saying "You've made the children of the world hate me now that they know I'm an Iraqi." In 1992, at barely eleven years of age, he won his first award in a workshop at the Mahmoud Mukhtar Museum, and the next year was given the best caricature award by a caricature magazine.<ref name="mawhopon"/><ref name="youm7"/>
  +   +
===Early life and Career===
  +   +
Ahmad Nady began his professional career at the early age of 14. It was during a period when his father was suffering from fatigue and overwork; And so Nady asked him to draw in a Lebanese magazine and his father agreed and encouraged him. He started out at first as an assistant at a workshop producing Pharaonic sculptures, before working with a number of magazines, including Karma ({{lang-ar|ÙØ±ÙØ©}}) company, known for several of its comics: Simsim's World ({{lang-ar|Ø¹Ø§ÙÙ Ø³ÙØ³Ù}} ''The arabic version [[Sesame Street]]''), Sameer and Alaa el-Din ({{lang-ar|Ø³ÙÙØ± Ø¹ÙØ§Ø¡ Ø§ÙØ¯ÙÙ}}) and the Young Arab ({{lang-ar|Ø§ÙØ¹Ø±Ø¨Ù Ø§ÙØµØºÙØ±}}) among others.<ref name="mawhopon"/>
  +   +
During this time, Nady started mailing several comic magazine editors with samples of his work and his ideas, all of which were rejected in Egypt. One of these, which was among his very first professional work, was called Fayek w Rayek ({{lang-ar|ÙØ§ÙÙ ÙØ±Ø§ÙÙ}}) after its two main characters, a [[Chimpanzee]] and [[Sloth]], who went through a series of adventures together. This series was published by the Saudi comic magazine Basme ({{lang-ar| Ø¨Ø§Ø³Ù}}), and was a success and very popular among children.<ref name="mawhopon"/>
  +   +
While steadily advancing as a comic artist, Nady began entering the realm of political cartoons. In 1996 he won third place in a UNESCO exhibition "''Where We Live''", and in 2004 participated in art exhibition organized by the Artists' Syndicate in solidarity with Palestine. He also promoted comics and cartoons by setting up numerous workshops over Egypt, including at least one in the [[Bibliotheca Alexandrina]]. He has also won three awards from [[deviantArt]], an online community of artists and exhibitionists for his artwork.<ref name="mawhopon"/>
  +   +
==Activism==
  +
===Pre-2011 revolution===
  +
He was a member of the [[6 April Youth Movement]] and the participated in [[National Association for Change]] popular campaign.<ref name="jadaliyya">{{cite web|url=http://www.jadaliyya.com/pages/index/2048/revolutionary-cartoons_an-interview-with-ahmad-nad|title=Revolutionary Cartoons: An Interview With Ahmad Nady |publisher=www.jadaliyya.com |date= |accessdate=2011-09-21}}</ref>
  +   +
===2011 revolution===
  +
Nady joined the revolution from the very beginning where he participated politically and artistically in [[Tahrir Square]]<ref name="jadaliyya"/>.
  +   +
===Post-2011 revolution===
  +
When asked about what should be done with [[National Democratic Party (Egypt)|National Democratic Party]]'s headquarter that was burned during [[2011 Egyptian revolution]], Nady praised the idea of trying the headquarter to a centre that holds cultural activities saying "It should be a place for workshops of all artistic fields inviting all artists from all over Egypt"<ref name="ahram2">{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/~/NewsContent/5/35/19486/Arts--Culture/Stage--Street/NDP-headquarters-building-what-will-it-be.aspx |title=NDP headquarters building- what will it be? - Stage & Street - Arts & Culture - Ahram Online |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date= |accessdate=2011-09-21}}</ref>
  +   +
==Awards and honors==
  +
===Local recognition===
  +
* Merit certificate of Mahmoud Mukhtar Museum Workshop, 1992.<ref name="FineArtSectorBiographies">[http://webcache.googleusercontent.com/search?q=cache:YSeuPIS_oWEJ:www.fineart.gov.eg/eng/cv/cv.asp%3FIDS%3D2146+http://www.fineart.gov.eg/Eng/CV/CV.asp%3FIDS%3D2146&cd=1&hl=en&ct=clnk&gl=ae FineArt Sector - Biographies - Ahmed Mohammed Nady]. 2011-09-05.Archived at webcite at http://www.webcitation.org/61TOArgrU</ref>
  +
* Prize for the best caricature on caricature magazine, 1993.<ref name="FineArtSectorBiographies"/>
  +
* Encouraging prize from the exhibition of "''Egypt in my Heart''", by the Republican Youth and the [[Ministry of Culture (Egypt)|Ministry of Culture]], 2004.<ref name="FineArtSectorBiographies"/>
  +
* Recognition Award from the Artists' Syndicate for his contribution to an art exhibition in solidarity with [[Palestine]], 2004.<ref name="FineArtSectorBiographies"/>
  +   +
===International recognition===
  +
* Third prize of [[UNESCO]] exhibition (Where We Live), 1996.<ref name="mawhopon"/><ref name="FineArtSectorBiographies"/>
  +
* Three Daily Deviations awards from Deviant Art for three consecutive years (2005 to 2007)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ahmad-nady.deviantart.com/gallery/32140719 |title=Daily Deviation on deviantART |publisher=www.deviantart.com |date= |accessdate=2011-09-19}}</ref>
  +   +
